result.execSummary:
The defendant Gina Marie LaFond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gina Marie LaFond is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gina Marie LaFond was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges.  Court ordered costs as to Case# 15CF000245.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense withdraws motion on postconviction relief.  No further action taken by Court.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rael informs the Court that a bed has become available at Meda House.  Court did not realize defendant has been revoked.  Defense needs to clear up revocation matter with the Probation/Parole department.  Court will not be able to modify her sentence until this has been resolved with Probation/Parole  Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence received and filed.  Discussions held with Attorney Rael, ADA Anderson and the Cort regarding postconviction motion.  Court will hear this matter on Monday, March 28, 2016 @ 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with Attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction - straight time; credit for 5 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2 YEARS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
-  no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause
-  cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent
-  AODA assessment and comply with any treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  No drug paraphernalia
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Perform 50 hours of community service
-  Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges.  Court ordered costs as to Case# 15CF000245
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed,
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered the signature bond reinstated with all previously ordered terms and conditions of bail.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentence date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant missed court on 06/18/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 06/23/2015 at 8:30, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Letter in Support of defendant received and filed.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time since he recently took over the case.  Court does not object to taking cases 14CM5092, 14CM1820, 14CM4090 and 14CM1656 from Branch 46 for global resolution.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Richard Carpenter for Eric M. Vega.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with Pick N Save located at 8770 S. Howell Avenue, in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond in court with attorney Michael Jude.  James J Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pleads not guilty as to Count 2. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Gina Marie LaFond not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 02-19-2015 at 01:30pm
